articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel announced a new military campaign against Hamas in central Gaza on Wednesday where Palestinian medics said dozens of people had been killed in airstrikes, complicating expected talks between mediators to try to finalise a ceasefire deal.
articles.title: Israel steps up military offensive in Gaza amid renewed truce efforts

articles.author: Ali Sawafta, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Deep divisions will limit progress at reconciliation talks between Palestinian factions Hamas and Fatah this month, conversations with five sources in the groups indicate, but the meetings highlight that the Islamist group is likely to retain influence after Israel's war in Gaza.
articles.title: Hamas signals post-war ambition in talks with Palestinian rival Fatah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi was set to meet his allies on Wednesday to discuss forming the government, a day after his Hindu nationalist party lost its outright majority in parliament in a surprise election verdict.
articles.title: India's Modi, allies to meet after humbling election verdict

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli court on Wednesday upheld a 35-day ban on Al Jazeera operations in Israel imposed by the government on national security grounds and a minister said he hoped to extend the ban for another 45 days when it runs out on Saturday.
articles.title: Israel court approves temporary ban on Al Jazeera, citing national security

articles.author: Jana Choukeir, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: A gunman fired shots at the U.S. Embassy in Lebanon on Wednesday and was wounded in an exchange of fire with troops, the Lebanese army said.
articles.title: Gunman fires shots at US Embassy in Lebanon, army says

articles.author: Wendell Roelf
articles.description: The African National Congress will give an early indication on Wednesday of its response to last week's election, which ended its 30-year run as the majority party and plunged South Africa into political uncertainty unseen in the democratic era.
articles.title: ANC to speak as South Africa waits to find out who will govern

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is promising to cut immigration levels if his Conservative Party wins next month's election, making the issue one of the major battlegrounds of the upcoming vote.
articles.title: Starmer vs Sunak: How Britain's parties are addressing immigration concerns

articles.author: Silvia Ognibene
articles.description: An Italian court found American Amanda Knox guilty of slander on Wednesday and handed her a three-year jail sentence in a case related to the murder in 2007 of her British flatmate.
articles.title: Italian court finds American Amanda Knox guilty of slander

articles.author: Aaron Ross
articles.description: In the months leading up to Kenya's deployment of police officers to Haiti, President William Ruto has consulted political advisers, security officials and foreign leaders about the high-profile anti-gang mission.
articles.title: Act of faith: Kenya enlists evangelical pastors to guide Haiti mission

articles.author: Anna Voitenko
articles.description: Ukrainian teenager Yelisei Mamonov dreams of attending his country's top technical university one day.
articles.title: Displaced Ukrainians make remote-controlled stretchers in family workshop
